Title:
Lophiostoma sagittiforme sp. nov., a new ascomycete
(Pleosporales, Dothideomycetes) from Island Yakushima in Japan.
Abstract:
Lophiostoma sagittiforme sp. nov. was collected from the
twigs of Machilus japonica in Island Yakushima, southern Japan. It is
characterized by the ascospores with an elongated narrow sheath
providing arrowhead-like tips. In terms of sheath morphology of
ascospores, L. sagittiforme is similar to some aquatic species of the
genus, e.g., L. armatisporum, L. bipolare, L. frondisubmersa, and L.
proprietunicatum, but differs form these species in having relatively
large-sized ascospores. Phylogenetic analyses based on the internal
transcribed region (ITS) -5.8S and partial large subunit of the nuclear
ribosomal DNA (LSU nrDNA) also supported the taxonomic classification of
L. sagittiforme in Lophiostoma.
